\/D:\/repos\/stride-translations\/pt-BR\: Default value changes ignored at runtime
Default value changes ignored at runtime
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
When you add a script to your project as a component, Game Studio lists its public variables in the Property Grid.
When you add a script to your project as a component, Game Studio lists its public variables in the Property Grid.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
These are the values used at runtime.
These are the values used at runtime.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
However, if you then change the default value in the script, Game Studio doesn't update the component with the new value.
However, if you then change the default value in the script, Game Studio doesn't update the component with the new value.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
For example, imagine you have a script with the variable <g1>SpeedFactor</g1> with a default value of <g2>5.0f</g2>.
For example, imagine you have a script with the variable <g1>SpeedFactor</g1> with a default value of <g2>5.0f</g2>.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
You add the script to the project as a component.
You add the script to the project as a component.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
Now, in the script, you change the default value of the <g3>SpeedFactor</g3> variable to <g4>6.0f</g4>, save the script, and run the project.
Now, in the script, you change the default value of the <g3>SpeedFactor</g3> variable to <g4>6.0f</g4>, save the script, and run the project.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
Game Studio doesn't update the component with the script changes, so the speed <g5>SpeedFactor</g5> value is still <g6>5.0f</g6>.
Game Studio doesn't update the component with the script changes, so the speed <g5>SpeedFactor</g5> value is still <g6>5.0f</g6>.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
Fix
Fix
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
In your project, delete and re-add the script component.
In your project, delete and re-add the script component.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
Alternatively, if you want Game Studio to update the values in the component properties after you change them in the script, you can do this with additional code.
Alternatively, if you want Game Studio to update the values in the component properties after you change them in the script, you can do this with additional code.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
You need to add a new line of code for every property you want this to apply to.
You need to add a new line of code for every property you want this to apply to.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
Add <g1>using System.ComponentModel</g1> at the top of the script.
Add <g1>using System.ComponentModel</g1> at the top of the script.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
Above the variable you want to update, add <g1>[DefaultValue()]</g1>.
Above the variable you want to update, add <g1>[DefaultValue()]</g1>.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
For example, if the variable is <g2>SpeedFactor</g2>, use:
For example, if the variable is <g2>SpeedFactor</g2>, use:
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
[DefaultValue(6.0f)]
[DefaultValue(6.0f)]
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
public float SpeedFactor { get; set; } = 6.0f;
public float SpeedFactor { get; set; } = 6.0f;
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
When you change the value, update both the <g1>SpeedFactor</g1> and the <g2>DefaultValue</g2> to the same value.
When you change the value, update both the <g1>SpeedFactor</g1> and the <g2>DefaultValue</g2> to the same value.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
<x1/>!Note<x2/>
<x1/>!Note<x2/>
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
This doesn't work in both directions.
This doesn't work in both directions.
/D:/repos/stride-translations/pt-BR/source/manual/troubleshooting/default-value-changes-ignored-at-runtime.md
If you set a value other than the <g1>DefaultValue</g1> in the Property Grid, Game Studio saves the value in the asset and overrides the default value at runtime.
If you set a value other than the <g1>DefaultValue</g1> in the Property Grid, Game Studio saves the value in the asset and overrides the default value at runtime.
